text: [Music]
hi
i'm mitu a cloud support engineer here
at the aws office in bangalore
today i am going to tell you why after
shutting down
an amazon elastic compute cloud instance
another instance of the same type
automatically launched
and show you how to stop new instances
from relaunching
let's get started some services
allow you to automatically launch
instances to replace terminated
instances
this is usually done to improve the
fault tolerance of an
application for example auto scaling
groups can be configured to launch an
instance to replace an instance
that is undergoing maintenance aws
elastic bleen stock environments
usually include auto scaling groups by
default
you can prevent an instance from
relaunching by deleting the auto scaling
group
or by terminating the elastic bean stock
environment
let's first go through the steps to
delete an auto scaling group
first open the aws management console
then navigate to the amazon elastic
compute cloud console
be sure that you're in the right region
if not choose the correct region from
the navigation bar
at the top of the screen amazon ec2
resources are region specific
choose running instances to view the ec2
instances
in the selected region i have an
instance running here
let's terminate this instance
select the instance go to actions
instance state choose terminate
and choose yes terminate
as you can see the instant state is now
changed to terminated
after a while i see another instance
with the same configuration
that's running on my ec2 console
to find the cause choose auto scaling
groups in the left navigation pane
and open it in a new window
to confirm which auto scaling group is
causing the relaunch
select the auto scaling group go to
activity history tab
in the navigation pane at the bottom of
the screen
and verify the instance id of the
instance recently launched
to prevent an auto scaling group from
relaunching the instance
select the auto scaling group choose
actions
delete confirm by choosing yes delete
after the auto scaling group is deleted
go back to the ec2 instances tab
you can now see that the instance has
been terminated
and no new instance is launched
if that didn't work terminate the
elastic beanstalk environment
if that is causing the instance relaunch
from the aws management console navigate
to the elastic beanstalk console
and then in the regions list select your
aws region
in the navigation pane choose
environments
and then choose the name of your
environment from the list
if you have many environments use the
search bar
to filter the environment list choose
environment
actions and then choose terminate
environment
enter the name of the environment to
confirm the termination
and then choose terminate it takes a few
minutes for elastic bean stock to
terminate the aws resources
running in the environment thanks for
watching
and happy cloud computing from all of us
here at aws
[Music]
